refnamediv.refpurpose: Groups of global keyboard accelerators for an entire GtkWindow

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Signal Prototypes
refsect1.synopsis: "accel-activate" gboolean user_function (GtkAccelGroup *accelgroup, GObject *arg1, guint arg2, GdkModifierType arg3, gpointer user_data); "accel-changed" void user_function (GtkAccelGroup *accelgroup, guint arg1, GdkModifierType arg2, GClosure *arg3, gpointer user_data);

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: A GtkAccelGroup represents a group of keyboard accelerators, typically attached to a toplevel GtkWindow (with gtk_window_add_accel_group()). Usually you won't need to create a GtkAccelGroup directly; instead, when using GtkItemFactory, GTK+ automatically sets up the accelerators for your menus in the item factory's GtkAccelGroup.

Note that accelerators are different from mnemonics. Accelerators are shortcuts for activating a menu item; they appear alongside the menu item they're a shortcut for. For example "Ctrl+Q" might appear alongside the "Quit" menu item. Mnemonics are shortcuts for GUI elements such as text entries or buttons; they appear as underlined characters. See gtk_label_new_with_mnemonic(). Menu items can have both accelerators and mnemonics, of course.

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_group_connect ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_accel_group_connect (GtkAccelGroup *accel_group, guint accel_key, GdkModifierType accel_mods, GtkAccelFlags accel_flags, GClosure *closure);
refsect2.para: Installs an accelerator in this group. When accel_group is being activated in response to a call to gtk_accel_groups_activate(), closure will be invoked if the accel_key and accel_mods from gtk_accel_groups_activate() match those of this connection.
The signature used for the closure is that of GtkAccelGroupActivate.
Note that, due to implementation details, a single closure can only be connected to one accelerator group.

listitem.simpara: the accelerator group to install an accelerator in
key value of the accelerator
modifier combination of the accelerator
a flag mask to configure this accelerator
closure to be executed upon accelerator activation

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_group_connect_by_path ()
refsect2.para: Installs an accelerator in this group, using an accelerator path to look up the appropriate key and modifiers (see gtk_accel_map_add_entry()). When accel_group is being activated in response to a call to gtk_accel_groups_activate(), closure will be invoked if the accel_key and accel_mods from gtk_accel_groups_activate() match the key and modifiers for the path.
The signature used for the closure is that of GtkAccelGroupActivate.

listitem.simpara: the accelerator group to install an accelerator in
path used for determining key and modifiers.
closure to be executed upon accelerator activation

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_group_lock ()
refsect2.para: Locks the given accelerator group.
Locking an acelerator group prevents the accelerators contained within it to be changed during runtime. Refer to gtk_accel_map_change_entry() about runtime accelerator changes.
If called more than once, accel_group remains locked until gtk_accel_group_unlock() has been called an equivalent number of times.

listitem.simpara: a GtkAccelGroup

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_group_unlock ()
refsect2.para: Undoes the last call to gtk_accel_group_lock() on this accel_group.

listitem.simpara: a GtkAccelGroup

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_groups_activate ()
refsect2.para: Finds the first accelerator in any GtkAccelGroup attached to object that matches accel_key and accel_mods, and activates that accelerator. If an accelerator was activated and handled this keypress, TRUE is returned.

listitem.simpara: the GObject, usually a GtkWindow, on which to activate the accelerator.
accelerator keyval from a key event
keyboard state mask from a key event
TRUE if the accelerator was handled, FALSE otherwise

refsect2.title: struct GtkAccelKey
gtk_accelerator_valid ()
refsect2.para: Determines whether a given keyval and modifier mask constitute a valid keyboard accelerator. For example, the GDK_a keyval plus GDK_CONTROL_MASK is valid - this is a "Ctrl+a" accelerator. But, you can't, for instance, use the GDK_Control_L keyval as an accelerator.

listitem.simpara: a GDK keyval
modifier mask
TRUE if the accelerator is valid

refsect2.title: gtk_accelerator_parse ()
refsect2.para: Parses a string representing an accelerator. The format looks like "<Control>a" or "<Shift><Alt>F1" or "<Release>z" (the last one is for key release). The parser is fairly liberal and allows lower or upper case, and also abbreviations such as "<Ctl>" and "<Ctrl>".
If the parse fails, accelerator_key and accelerator_mods will be set to 0 (zero).

listitem.simpara: string representing an accelerator
return location for accelerator keyval
return location for accelerator modifier mask

refsect2.title: gtk_accelerator_name ()
refsect2.para: Converts an accelerator keyval and modifier mask into a string parseable by gtk_accelerator_parse(). For example, if you pass in GDK_q and GDK_CONTROL_MASK, this function returns "<Control>q".
The caller of this function must free the returned string.

listitem.simpara: accelerator keyval
accelerator modifier mask
a newly-allocated accelerator name

refsect2.title: gtk_accelerator_set_default_mod_mask ()
refsect2.para: Sets the modifiers that will be considered significant for keyboard accelerators. The default mod mask is GDK_CONTROL_MASK | GDK_SHIFT_MASK | GDK_MOD1_MASK, that is, Control, Shift, and Alt. Other modifiers will by default be ignored by GtkAccelGroup. You must include at least the three default modifiers in any value you pass to this function.
The default mod mask should be changed on application startup, before using any accelerator groups.

listitem.simpara: accelerator modifier mask

refsect2.title: gtk_accelerator_get_default_mod_mask ()
refsect2.para: Gets the value set by gtk_accelerator_set_default_mod_mask().

listitem.simpara: the default accelerator modifier mask
